text: External forces shape human experience and behavior
Beliefs about agency influence how we attribute causality
IF  THEN Perceive agency in external forces before projecting it internally
IF  THEN Cultural context determines how we interpret psychological phenomena
CLAIM: Primitive beliefs about mana entities predate modern psychological concepts
CLAIM: Materialism represents an archaic framework for understanding human experience
Foundational causes of certain conditions may lie in psychological factors rather than purely physical ones.
Effective operational approaches to certain conditions must address psychological aspects, not just physical symptoms.
IF  THEN Consider psychological factors before dismissing conditions as purely physical.
IF  THEN Treatment protocols for certain conditions must prioritize understanding and addressing the mind-body connection.
CLAIM: The psyche serves as a causal factor in certain conditions, influencing outcomes and treatment efficacy.
CLAIM: The operational scope of certain conditions extends beyond purely physical or mental categories.
